Package model

Class Checkpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Checkpoint
  • public class Checkpoint
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a checkpoint in the game. Manages all information about the checkpoint.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean[] carsPassed
      Each boolean of the array is set to true once the corresponding car has passed the checkpoint.
      private int[][] coordinates
      Stores coordinates of each tile of the checkpoint.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Checkpoint​(int x, int y, int numberOfCars)
      The Checkpoint class constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addTile​(int x, int y)
      Adds another CHECKPOINT tile to this checkpoint.
      void carPassed​(int car)
      Saves that the given car has passed this checkpoint.
      boolean getCarPassed​(int car)
      Returns true if the given car has passed this checkpoint.
      int getNoOfTiles()
      Returns the number of tiles this checkpoint contains.
      int getXOfTile​(int tileIndex)
      Returns the X coordinate of the given tile.
      int getYOfTile​(int tileIndex)
      Returns the Y coordinate of the given tile.
      boolean tileBelongsTo​(int x, int y)
      Returns true if the tile with given coordinates belongs to this checkpoint.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • coordinates

        private int[][] coordinates
        Stores coordinates of each tile of the checkpoint.

      • carsPassed

        private boolean[] carsPassed
        Each boolean of the array is set to true once the corresponding car has passed the checkpoint.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checkpoint

        public Checkpoint​(int x,
                  int y,
                  int numberOfCars)
        The Checkpoint class constructor. Creates new Checkpoint containing one tile. Initializes boolean[] carPassed with the length equal to the number of cars in the game.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the first tile to be added to this checkpoint.
        y - the Y coordinate of the first tile to be added to this checkpoint.
        numberOfCars - the number of cars in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • addTile

        public void addTile​(int x,
                    int y)
        Adds another CHECKPOINT tile to this checkpoint.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the tile to be added to this checkpoint.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile to be added to this checkpoint.

      • getNoOfTiles

        public int getNoOfTiles()
        Returns the number of tiles this checkpoint contains.
        Returns:
        the number of tiles this checkpoint contains.

      • getXOfTile

        public int getXOfTile​(int tileIndex)
        Returns the X coordinate of the given tile.
        Parameters:
        tileIndex - the index which determines of which tile is to be returned the X coordinate.
        Returns:
        the X coordinate of the tile of this checkpoint determined by the index.

      • getYOfTile

        public int getYOfTile​(int tileIndex)
        Returns the Y coordinate of the given tile.
        Parameters:
        tileIndex - the index which determines of which tile is to be returned the Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        the X coordinate of the tile of this checkpoint determined by the index.

      • tileBelongsTo

        public boolean tileBelongsTo​(int x,
                             int y)
        Returns true if the tile with given coordinates belongs to this checkpoint.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the tile to be checked whether it belongs to this checkpoint.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile to be checked whether it belongs to this checkpoint.
        Returns:
        true if the tile with given coordinates belongs to this checkpoint.

      • carPassed

        public void carPassed​(int car)
        Saves that the given car has passed this checkpoint.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which has passed this checkpoint.

      • getCarPassed

        public boolean getCarPassed​(int car)
        Returns true if the given car has passed this checkpoint.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which is to be checked whether it has passed this checkpoint.
        Returns:
        true if the given car has passed this checkpoint.
